article.headline: Fairfield 65, Harvard 60
article.story: BOSTON (AP) -- Rob Thomson scored 16 points and grabbed 12 rebounds while Deng Gai added 11 points and 12 rebounds Friday, carrying Fairfield to a 65-60 victory over Harvard. Michael Beal led Harvard (0-1) with 12 points and 8 rebounds. Kevin Rogus was the leading scorer for the Crimson with 13 points. Harvard made only 20 of 59 shots from the field and were outrebounded 47-37. Fairfield (1-0) held Harvard to one basket, a Beal jumper, through the first nine minutes of the opening half and twice took 11 point leads. But the Crimson went on a 19-8 run with 7:59 showing on the first half clock that was capped 23 seconds into the second half on a Beal jumper taking their first lead 27-25. The Stags made a comeback with a 8-4 run starting at the 5:50 mark of the second half and took a 57-55 lead on two free throws by Gai with 3:32 remaining. The lead changed hands six times before Thomson made one of two free throws with 2:26 left and Fairfield never trailed again.
